articles.headline: In Rebuilding Iraq’s Oil Industry, U.S. Subcontractors Hold Sway
articles.snippet: Some of the largest oil fields auctioned by the Iraqis went to non-American companies, but American-based concerns have won the largest subcontracts to drill for oil and refurbish equipment.
articles.abstract: Some of the largest oil fields auctioned by the Iraqis went to non-American companies, but American-based concerns have won the largest subcontracts to drill for oil and refurbish equipment.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — When Iraq auctioned rights to rebuild and expand its oil industry two years ago, the Russian company Lukoil won a hefty portion — a field holding about 10 percent of Iraq’s known oil reserves.

articles.headline: Reviled Tycoon, Assad’s Cousin, Resigns in Syria
articles.snippet: Rami Makhlouf, a cousin of President Bashar al-Assad, said he was quitting business, a move seen as a major concession to antigovernment protesters.
articles.abstract: Rami Makhlouf, a cousin of President Bashar al-Assad, said he was quitting business, a move seen as a major concession to antigovernment protesters.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Syria’s most powerful businessman, a confidant and cousin of President Bashar al-Assad, announced on Thursday that he was quitting business and moving to charity work, Syrian television said. The move, if true, would suggest that Mr. Assad was so concerned about the continuing protests that he would sacrifice a relative to public anger.

articles.headline: RIM Profit Falls Below Estimates
articles.snippet: Research in Motion’s stock declined 15 percent in extended trading after a poor earnings report and a second reduction this year in its forecast.
articles.abstract: Research in Motion’s stock declined 15 percent in extended trading after a poor earnings report and a second reduction this year in its forecast.
articles.lead_paragraph: OTTAWA — After reducing its profit forecast seven weeks ago, Research in Motion, the maker of the BlackBerry, turned in earnings results on Thursday that were even worse than analysts’ lowered expectations.

articles.headline: A Schizophrenic, a Slain Worker, Troubling Questions
articles.snippet: After a counselor was killed by a resident at a mental health facility in Massachusetts, many people wondered whether the system had failed.
articles.abstract: After a counselor was killed by a resident at a mental health facility in Massachusetts, many people wondered whether the system had failed.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON — Last November, Yvette Chappell found herself increasingly anxious that her 27-year-old son, Deshawn James Chappell, was spiraling downward into deep psychosis. He was exhibiting intense paranoia and calling late at night to complain about deafening voices in his head.

articles.headline: Worries Grow About Breadth of Debt Crisis
articles.snippet: For now, at least, investors seem to believe that the United States has enough shock absorbers to comfortably withstand a default by Greece.
articles.abstract: For now, at least, investors seem to believe that the United States has enough shock absorbers to comfortably withstand a default by Greece.
articles.lead_paragraph: The tumult in the European monetary zone is spreading concern among investors of a broader crisis in financial markets from Ireland to Spain.

articles.headline: On the Hunt For a Better 401(k) Plan
articles.snippet: Small companies that would like to cut 401(k) costs and improve their investment options should consider one man’s pursuit.
articles.abstract: Small companies that would like to cut 401(k) costs and improve their investment options should consider one man’s pursuit.
articles.lead_paragraph: It generally isn’t easy to make improvements to your 401(k) plan.
